meanings.sent1: She used a cloth to efface the whiteboard after the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The rain started to efface the chalk drawings on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: Trying to efface a permanent marker drawing with an eraser was a futile attempt.
meanings.sent4: The waves of the ocean efface footprints in the sand, leaving a clean slate.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a brush to efface the mistake on the canvas, restoring its perfection.

meanings.definition: To make oneself inconspicuous or humble
meanings.sent1: Feeling embarrassed, she tried to efface herself in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: He always tried to efface his achievements and remain modest.
meanings.sent3: In an attempt to efface himself, he accidentally bumped into the wall.
meanings.sent4: The shy student would efface herself in group discussions, avoiding attention.
meanings.sent5: The humble leader would efface his own needs to prioritize the team's success.
